pullRequest.body:
- move definitions to `Topology/Defs/Basic`;
- move the last lemma to `Topology/LocalAtTarget`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Topology.LocallyClosed | 708 | 626 | -82 (-11.58%) |
| Mathlib.Topology.LocalAtTarget | 707 | 708 | +1 (+0.14%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.LocallyClosed`|-82|
|<details><summary>8 files</summary> `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.OpenImmersion` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.IsIso` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UnderlyingMap` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.ClosedImmersion` `Mathlib.Topology.LocalAtTarget` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Affine` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.Separated` `Mathlib.AlgebraicGeometry.Morphisms.UniversallyClosed`</details>|1|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>
The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Forgive my ignorance, but is there an obvious reason the import chain should be reversed in the case of `LocallyClosed` and `LocalAtTarget`?
I think that `LocallyClosed` is a basic predicate like `IsOpen` or `IsClosed` while `LocalAtTarget` depends on `Topology.Sets.Opens` which depends on a lot of stuff.
bors d+

:v: urkud can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10167687675/job/28120620948)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10167687675/job/28120620295)

Thanks for doing this! I have one pre-existing comment on a docstring.
maintainer merge

Thanks for doing this! I have one pre-existing comment on a docstring.
maintainer merge
Can you mention the file `Mathlib/Topology/LocallyClosed.lean` where the API lemmas are? Thanks.

```suggestion
Also see `isLocallyClosed_tfae` and other lemmas in `Mathlib/Topology/LocallyClosed`.
```

I know you just moved the comment, but: I'm stumbling over the grammar of that sentence.
Do you mean "This is the largest set `t` such that `s` is closed in `t`", or "This is the largest set in which `s` is closed"?
I added the comment in the first place. To me the the two clauses mean the same thing though (and both of them are better than my original wording). Can you please clarify?

I agree with Michael. As written, the sentence doesn't parse.
```suggestion
This is the largest set in which `s` is closed, and `s` is locally closed if and only if
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Topology/LocallyClosed): move around
